sense.name: readying
sense.commentary: the activity of putting or setting in order some act or purpose
sense.examples: Preparations for the ceremony had begun. She made preparations for her first day at the new job. Her preparations consisted of packing a lunch and ironing her shirt.

sense.name: a substance
sense.commentary: formulation - a substance prepared according to a formula
sense.examples: He poured the preparation into the test tube.

sense.name: thinking
sense.commentary: planning, provision - the cognitive process of thinking about what you will do in the event of something happening
sense.examples: His preparation for retirement was hindered by several uncertainties. Sally's fire preparation consisted of going over all the exit routes.

sense.name: preparedness
sense.commentary: readiness - the state of having been made ready or prepared for use or action (especially military action)
sense.examples: Putting them in preparation ... Their preparation was more than adequate.

sense.name: precursor
sense.commentary: a note that produces a dissonant chord is first heard in a consonant chord.
sense.examples: The resolution of one dissonance is often the preparation for another dissonance.

sense.name: homework
sense.commentary: prep - preparatory schoolwork done outside school (especially at home)
sense.examples: George did his preparations for math class at the kitchen table. Fido did his preparations for obedience school in the backyard.

sense.name: cooking
sense.commentary: cookery - the act of preparing something (as food) by the application of heat
sense.examples: Food preparation can be a great art. People are needed who have experience in preparation. He left he preparation of meals to his wife.
